qas.question: Who were the beats Kanye made in the 90's originally intended for?
What types of records did Kanye sample in his early career.
What music group did Kanye join when he couldn't release his solo album?
In what time period did Kanye begin producing?
When did Kanye West start his production career?
For which artist did Kanye West act as a ghost producer?
What late 1990s Chicago rap group was Kanye West a member of?
What firm managed Kanye West's rap group?
What year was the first Go-Getters album released?

context: Kanye West began his early production career in the <a3_0><a4_0>mid-1990s<a4_0/><a3_0/>, making beats primarily for burgeoning <a0_0>local artists<a0_0/>, eventually developing a style that involved speeding up vocal samples from <a1_0>classic soul records<a1_0/>. His first official production credits came at the age of nineteen when he produced eight tracks on Down to Earth, the 1996 debut album of a Chicago rapper named Grav. For a time, West acted as a ghost producer for <a5_0>Deric "D-Dot" Angelettie<a5_0/>. Because of his association with D-Dot, West wasn't able to release a solo album, so he formed and became a member and producer of the <a2_0><a6_0>Go-Getters<a6_0/><a2_0/>, a late-1990s Chicago rap group composed of him, GLC, Timmy G, Really Doe, and Arrowstar. His group was managed by John "Monopoly" Johnson, Don Crowley, and Happy Lewis under the management firm <a7_0>Hustle Period<a7_0/>. After attending a series of promotional photo shoots and making some radio appearances, The Go-Getters released their first and only studio album World Record Holders in <a8_0>1999<a8_0/>. The album featured other Chicago-based rappers such as Rhymefest, Mikkey Halsted, Miss Criss, and Shayla G. Meanwhile, the production was handled by West, Arrowstar, Boogz, and Brian "All Day" Miller.
